genius.core.protocol

Class DefaultMultilateralProtocol

  • java.lang.Object
    • genius.core.protocol.DefaultMultilateralProtocol
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MultilateralProtocol
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AlternatingMultipleOffersProtocol, MediatorProtocol, StackedAlternatingOffersProtocol

    public class DefaultMultilateralProtocol
extends java.lang.Object
implements MultilateralProtocol
    An adapter for the protocol class. This implements default functionality for the methods in the Protocol interface and return default values for them.
    Author:
    David Festen

    • Method Detail

      • getRoundStructure

        public Round getRoundStructure(java.util.List<NegotiationParty> parties,
                               Session session)
        Description copied from interface: MultilateralProtocol
        Get the structure of the current round. Each round, this method receives a list of all the NegotiationParty and the complete Session which can be used to diversify the round structure at some point during the session.
        Specified by:
        getRoundStructure in interface MultilateralProtocol
        Parameters:
        parties - The parties currently participating
        session - The complete session history
        Returns:
        A list of possible actions

      • beforeSession

        public java.util.Map<NegotiationParty,java.util.List<Action>> beforeSession(Session session,
                                                                            java.util.List<NegotiationParty> parties)
                                                                     throws NegotiationPartyTimeoutException,
                                                                            java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException,
                                                                            java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from interface: MultilateralProtocol
        Returns a list of Actions to be sent to NegotiationParty.receiveMessage(AgentID, Action) . This will get called just before the session starts. If some initialization with needs to be done by the protocol, it can be done here.
        Specified by:
        beforeSession in interface MultilateralProtocol
        Parameters:
        session - The upcoming Session
        parties - The NegotiationPartys that will participate in the session
        Throws:
        NegotiationPartyTimeoutException
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • afterSession

        public void afterSession(Session session,
                         java.util.List<NegotiationParty> parties)
        Description copied from interface: MultilateralProtocol
        This will get called just after ending the session. If the protocol needs to do some post session steps, it can be done here. Protocols should not handle NegotiationParty.negotiationEnded(Bid) as these are always called by the SessionManager.
        Specified by:
        afterSession in interface MultilateralProtocol
        Parameters:
        session - The session instance that was used for the session
        parties - The parties that participated in the session

      • applyAction

        public void applyAction(Action action,
                        Session session)
                 throws ActionException
        Description copied from interface: MultilateralProtocol
        Apply the action according to the protocol. All actions done by all agents come through this method. The protocol should check here if the agent's action is actually allowed and contains the proper data.
        Specified by:
        applyAction in interface MultilateralProtocol
        Parameters:
        action - action to apply. The Agent ID in the action already has been checked when this is called.
        session - the current state of this session
        Throws:
        ActionException - if the proposed action is illegal according to the protocol.

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished(Session session,
                          java.util.List<NegotiationParty> parties)
        Description copied from interface: MultilateralProtocol
        Check if the protocol is done or still busy. If this method returns true, the SessionManager will not start a new Round after the current one. It will however finish all the turns described in the MultilateralProtocol.getRoundStructure(java.util.List, genius.core.session.Session) method.
        Specified by:
        isFinished in interface MultilateralProtocol
        Parameters:
        session - the current state of this session
        parties - all the parties involved in the negotiation
        Returns:
        true if the protocol is finished

      • getActionListeners

        public java.util.Map<NegotiationParty,java.util.List<NegotiationParty>> getActionListeners(java.util.List<NegotiationParty> parties)
        Get a map of parties that are listening to each other's response
        Specified by:
        getActionListeners in interface MultilateralProtocol
        Parameters:
        parties - The parties involved in the current negotiation
        Returns:
        A map where the key is a NegotiationParty that is responding to a NegotiationParty.chooseAction(java.util.List) event, and the value is a list of NegotiationParty that are listening to that key party's response.

      • getCurrentAgreement

        public Bid getCurrentAgreement(Session session,
                               java.util.List<NegotiationParty> parties)
        This method should return the current agreement.

        Some protocols only have an agreement at the negotiation session, make sure that this method returns null until the end of the session in that case, because this method might be queried at intermediary steps.

        Specified by:
        getCurrentAgreement in interface MultilateralProtocol
        Parameters:
        session - The complete session history up to this point
        parties - The parties involved in the current negotiation
        Returns:
        The agreed upon bid or null if no agreement

      • getNumberOfAgreeingParties

        public int getNumberOfAgreeingParties(Session session,
                                      java.util.List<NegotiationParty> parties)
        Gets the number of parties that currently agree to the offer.

        Default implementation returns 0 if no agreement or number of parties if agreement exists.

        Specified by:
        getNumberOfAgreeingParties in interface MultilateralProtocol
        Parameters:
        session - the current state of this session
        parties - The parties currently participating
        Returns:
        the number of parties agreeing to the current agreement

      • includeOnly

        public java.util.Collection<NegotiationParty> includeOnly(java.util.Collection<NegotiationParty> negotiationParties,
                                                          java.lang.Class negotiationPartyClass)
        Filters the list by including only the type of negotiation parties. Optionally, this behavior can be reversed (i.e. excluding only the given type of negotiation parties).
        Parameters:
        negotiationParties - The original list of parties
        negotiationPartyClass - The type of parties to include
        Returns:
        The filtered list of parties

      • exclude

        public java.util.Collection<NegotiationParty> exclude(java.util.Collection<NegotiationParty> negotiationParties,
                                                      java.lang.Class negotiationPartyClass)
        Filters the list by including only the type of negotiation parties. Optionally, this behavior can be reversed (i.e. excluding only the given type of negotiation parties).
        Parameters:
        negotiationParties - The original list of parties
        negotiationPartyClass - The type of parties to include
        Returns:
        The filtered list of parties
